parameters: (I need to thank the village chief before I leave here...)

(Before I leave this place, I must say thank you to the
village chief...)

(Before I leave here, I must say thanks to the village
chief...)

Yes, thanks to you, I've recovered and am feeling energetic.
I've received so much care from you, Village Chief... I
truly appreciate it,

It's nothing, really. In this port town, working on boats is
our livelihood. It's only natural for a fellow seafarer and
a man of the sea to help someone who's been shipwrecked.

I'm very grateful. When I fell from the ship... I mean, when
I fell into the sea, I thought it was the end...

Kisanosuke and the others are waiting. It's best if you
leave this village quickly. Since yesterday, the authorities
have been searching for a criminal who escaped from the
island. It's actually safer in the crowded city of Edo.

I heard rumors a year ago that Kisanosuke had been exiled to
an island. I figured he must have escaped, so I deliberately
didn't ask. Haha.

This Uraga isn't safe either. This is a parting gift. Take
it with you on your journey to Edo. Tell Kisanosuke to be
happy with Kachou-san.
...Thank you very much, Village Chief. I am indebted to you.

I won't ask why you were exiled to this island... There must
have been some circumstances, but you don't seem like a bad
person. I can tell by looking into your eyes. After all, I
am the village chief. Life is always a journey in progress.
Have a good trip--

I am the village chief here. You've been asleep for quite a
long time. I'll go call Kisanosuke and the others, so wait
here.
(...Did everyone make it...? Where is this place...?)

I'm so relieved. You were the only one who hadn't woken up,
so we were all worried...

Ha ha! There's no way Karin would be taken down by something
like this, right? You've been sleeping for three days, so
you should have regained your strength.

Everyone... is safe... We made it across the rough sea,
didn't we? I'm so glad...

All of us who fell into the sea were pulled to the shore by
Kisanosuke-san, who tied ropes to flotation bags and swam us
there.

I used to be a fisherman--I'm good at swimming. It was
fortunate that the land was closer than we thought.
Thank you, Kisanosuke-san. Where have we ended up...?

This is Uraga. It's a port that serves as the gateway to Edo
Bay. Now that you're awake, we must hurry and depart before
the officials notice us.

I used to live here, so I'm familiar with the area. Let's
walk back to Edo from here.

Wait, both of you. Karin-san, you've just woken up, so it's
dangerous to start walking suddenly. Please come to the
village entrance once you're feeling better.

That's a relief. All three of you were worried about the
young lady, so this is quite moving♪

Village chief, we truly owe you a lot. It was fortunate that
the place we drifted ashore was Uraga, your hometown and a
place familiar to your face.

When I found out that the castaway we found on the beach was
Kisanosuke, I was surprised too, but it's good to see you're
safe. Take care on your way back to Edo with your cute wife,
you lucky fellow.

Ah, sorry about that! I thought they'd trust us more if I
said Kachou-san was my wife... I just went ahead and said
it... My apologies (whispering).
...! Geez, doing things on your own... (whispering)

Karin. If we all stay together, the villagers will become
suspicious. We'll be waiting outside first. Come quickly,
okay?
--The three left the village chief's house.
